verses.roman:
phalānāṁ patatāṁ śabdaṁ
niśamyāsura-rāsabhaḥ
abhyadhāvat kṣiti-talaṁ
sa-nagaṁ parikampayan

synonyms: phalānām—of the fruits; patatām—which are falling; śabdam—the sound; niśamya—hearing; asura-rāsabhaḥ—the demon in the form of a jackass; abhyadhāvat—ran forward; kṣiti-talam—the surface of the earth; sa-nagam—together with the trees; parikampayan—making tremble.
translation: Hearing the sound of the falling fruits, the ass demon Dhenuka ran forward to attack, making the earth and trees tremble.
